timeline.bodyText: why do we need this requireNonNull here?
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
why do we need this requireNonNull here?

It's just to reduce the warnings you get in the code.
replies.author: jmelchio

timeline.bodyText: looks like this change is prompted by similar code in InternalConfigurationPersistenceService to create the internal region. Would be nice to change that code to use this method as well.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: That is a good idea but I think we should do it in another pull request. I will file a refactor ticket about not using the deprecated AttributesFactory to create internal regions. So this PR introduces the new RegionFactoryImpl but will only use it in the new code in this PR. The other ticket can look for other places in the code (like the one you mention) that use deprecated apis to create internal regions.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: looks like this is only used in the test now. Should be removed.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: Thanks for catching this! We intended to remove it but forgot to do so
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: I am always not a fan of  "Impl" class. Wondering why we couldn't make RebalanceResult a concrete class directly.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: Yes, let us look at that. Agree that given that we're extending an interface already in RebalanceResult it makes sense to make RebalanceResult the implemenation.
replies.author: jmelchio

replies.bodyText:
This PR did not introduce RebalanceResult nor RebalanceResultImpl.
I prefer keeping the current interface and having an internal implementation class. This prevents our external apis from having internal things exposed. For example, in this case, the external api does not need a constructor nor settors.
I think it would be good to have more of our external api contract defined by interfaces and try to minimize the number of classes in it.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText:
ps: I'm fine with some other name for the class that implements the RebalanceResult.
I also find it odd that RebalanceResult has "getSuccess()" and "getStatusMessage()" but its super interface "OperationResult" is empty. It seems like both of these would be reasonable things to expect from every OperationResult.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText:
I filed a geode ticket about moving those methods up to OperationResult.
The team talked and we decided it would be best to keep the impl class
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: I know this isn't introduced by this PR, but now I am wondering: V really isn't used by this interface, why do we need to declare it here?
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
I know this isn't introduced by this PR, but now I am wondering: V really isn't used by this interface, why do we need to declare it here?

We need this to maintain the coupling between the operation and the result in the implementations of ClusterManagementOperation.
replies.author: jmelchio

timeline.bodyText: this is something that I had hoped that could be built in the result that's coming back from the "start" operation.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: We decided as a team to look into adding a way for the java api user to block until the started op has completed.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: We added "getFuture" to the ClusterManagementService. We thought this was cleaner than adding "getFuture" to ClusterManagementOperationResult because if we did that it would need to have a reference to the ClusterManagementService to repeatedly call "get".
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Gang: please change it to one week.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: internal region needs to be started with "_" or "__".
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: This has been changed to start with "". I found a validator that does not allow names to start with "".
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Consider using Java's very nice Duration and Instant classes to carry information about durations and instants.
timeline.author: demery-pivotal

replies.bodyText: constructor now takes a Duration instead of a long and a TimeUnit
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.message:
renamed OperationStateDistributionService to OperationStateStore
the region that stores operation state now has a name that starts with "__"
removed ClusterManagementOperationStatusResult

Add synchronous get for operation results

Co-authored-by: Joris Melchior <joris.melchior@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Darrel Schneider <dschneider@pivotal.io>

changed completed operation timeout from 2 hours to 7 days.
The Duration class is also used now instead of TimeUnit.
removed dead code: executor was never a ExecutorService instance
cleaned up ClusterManagementOperationResult
Merge branch 'develop' into distributed-rebalance-status
Merge branch 'develop' into distributed-rebalance-status

Fix RebalanceManagementDunitTest test for repeated run fail

Authored-by: Joris Melchior <joris.melchior@gmail.com>
